annotations.title: Every bartender's bane made easy - How to make a Ramos gin fizz cocktail

textContent:
2oz Gin
.5oz Simple syrup (originally .25oz)
.75oz Lemon juice
.75oz Lime juice
1oz Heavy cream
3 drops orange flower water
1 Egg white

Add egg and lemon to shaker first, then add everything but the cream
Shake vigorously for like 5 minutes
Add two ice cubes.
Shake until ice is gone. 
Add cream and shake for 5 seconds or so to incorporate. 
Gently pour without straining into collins glass. 
Top with Seltzer and lemon peel (optional). 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YHRg3iCuwzw

---

2 oz gin
0.75 oz Simple syrup
0.75 oz Heavy cream
0.5 oz Lime juice
0.5 oz Lemon juice
1 Egg white
2 Dashes Orange blossom water
1 ml Vanilla extract
2.5 oz Soda water

Place a collins glass in the freezer
Meanwhile, in a shaker, pour the gin, syrup, cream, vanilla and egg white 
Add the spring from a strainer
Dry shake for one minute
Add 30 to 45 gr of ice
Shake until ice has completely melted
Take the glass out of the freezer and add 1.5 oz of cold soda water in the glass and 2 dashes of orange blossom water
Dump the cocktail in the glass and place the galss back in the freezer for 3 minutes
With a straw, poke a whole in the middle of the foam and pour another oz of soda water in the whole
Place the straw back in the middle of the cocktail
And this is how you make the perfect Ramos gin fizz cocktail recipe
